content: I’m Jamie Pask, Web Engineer from Wales (next to England).
Currently living in Los Angeles, working as a freelance web developer and on the look out for some new, exciting opportunities. Feel free to
if you’re looking to create some awesome projects together.

blocks.content: The typical British guy meets American girl on a study abroad trip story. Leading to a move across the world and a career change.

At the time of meeting my future wife, I had graduated from Cardiff Metropolitan University with a Bachelor of Science degree in Architectural Design & Technology, and was working as a Technician in a well respected, local Architecture firm.

Task automation and software enchantments became commonplace and led to a self education in all things software. On a 3 month trip to Los Angeles in 2015, I developed my very first simple, web based portfolio and have been consistently researching web technologies ever since. I took the dive into a full career change in 2019, working as a freelance developer for various clients.

content: to have worked on some exciting projects with these awesome brands.

blocks.content:
Working as a freelance developer for Techyscouts, my day to day ranges from fixing legacy code bugs, to producing brand new sites using the latest technologies. Here’s some of the more interesting roles I’ve taken on at the company:

  • Produced technical solutions for a variety of issues, ranging from UI to hosting issues
  • Consumed a range of third party API’s. For instance, using Loyalty Lion’s API to generate custom CSV files, exporting and storing for local download within an S3 bucket.
  • Coordinated development, deployment and maintenance techniques for collaborative work. In particular, creating local environments within Docker containers, incorporating CI/CD processes with GIT hooks and documenting preferred workflows for future projects.
  • Built custom Wordpress themes, Shopify themes and apps using modern build tools, specifically, Webpack and Gulp, to incorporate current web technologies and improve maintainability.
  • Replicated Figma/Photoshop/XD files to pixel accuracy.
  • Adhered to coding standards through consistent research and incorporating linters into my workflow.

I have also been fortunate enough to be in contact with a few companies in Vancouver and contracted work for them including Nextjs and Shopify builds.

  • Incorporated Shopify into a pre-existing NextJS application by consuming the Storefront API. The project involved pulling Shopify product data for displaying and filtering, creating a functional ajax cart with Redux state management and ensuring a robust checkout system.
  • Used a git workflow to assist senior developers.
  • Made various improvements and bug fixes for multiple clients in both Shopify and Wordpress sites.
  • Built emailing templates through Mailchimp and other CRM’s.
